attributes.action: limit the number of internet providers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Some may argue that competition enhances technological advance - but the largely public sector telecommunications industry has traditionally been very well supervised by govt., probably because it is catering for public tastes. 

Television has kept to five channels -
unlike the internet.

I fear that the quality of internet provision is deteriorating at the expense of quantity - the petitioner is calling on the British govt, to not necessarily curtail the number or type of sites of this phenomenally expanding educational and business resource, but limit the number of providers (eg google, AOL). The idea of my petition is to encourage accountability for what is published in an international forum and facilitate the ease with which the www can be policed.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
